data.title: Person:Mark Dempsey (4)
meta_keywords: Mark Dempsey and Catarena Van Wagenar (1)
data.text:
https://familysearch.org/photos/stories/2175227?p=901161

Mark Dempsey II & Catarena Van Wagenar

Submitted by William Lloyd Fackrell Narrative given to William by Alice J. Walker

Source, The Settlement of Upper Canada. by William Canniff. 1869, republished by Mika Publishing, 1983, pgs 646-7 The Settlers of the Beekman Patent

Mark Dempsey, was born abt 1750-55 and married Caty Wagoner in Poughkeepsie 14 April 1776. (PRCh). Mark Dimsey was 1st Seergt, in Capt. Bernardus Swartwout's Company of Militia in Coll. John Freer's Regiment 6 June 1778. He was taxed Poughkeepsie Precinct from 1775 through 1778 and was there in 1790 at 1-2-5 and was between Hendrick Hermanse and Aaron Romar. There are no local records for deaths or burials for this family,

Children

1. Thomas, b. 16 Nov. bp. 21 Dec 1777 with Sp. Thomas Miller and Elizabeth Wagoner. (PRCh).

2. Margreta, b. 29 Dec 1779, bp. 6 Feb 1780

3. Elizabeth b. 17 June, bp. 7 July 1782 with Sp. Caspanus and Elizabeth Westervelt. (PRCh).

4. Magdelin, b. 29 Nov 1784, bp. 13 Feb. 1785

5. Mark b. 26 Sept, bp 4 Nov. 1787 in Fishkill, (FRCh).

6. Mary, b 3 May, bp, 25 July 1790 (PRCh).

http://worldconnect.rootsweb.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=uidiomasaigh&id=I7183

Other Known Locations (Date and Place)

__ ___ 1752 Poughkeepsie Town (Dutchess) NY (birth)

14 Apr 1776 Poughkeepsie Town (Dutchess) NY (marriage)

08 Jul 17__ ________ (________) __, (enlisted in 3rd Regiment)

__ Jun 1775 Camp Ticonderoga (Essex) NY (military service)

28 Sep 1775 Camp Ticonderoga (Essex) NY (sick in camp)

__ ___ 1790 Poughkeepsie Town (Dutchess) NY, USA (census)

__ ___ 1810 ________ (Schoharie) NY, USA (census)

__ ___ 1810 aft Schoharie (Schoharie) NY, USA (death)

__ ___ 1810 aft ________ (________) ___ (burial)

Comments and Traditions:

Married by "Banns or Licence" in the Reformed Dutch Church.

Served as a Private with Captain Lewis Dunboy's Company in Colonel James Clinton's 3rd Regiment in the NY Line during the Revolutionary War. Participated in the Battles of Saratoga (1777).

Appears in 1790 census as male, over 16.

Appears in 1810 census.

Died between 1810 and 1840.

Source: Ancestry World Tree Project: Arthur W. Dempsey Jr. dempseyxng2@peoplepc.com

Mark, Marcus, Dimsey, Demsey, Dempsy

Other known locations:

08 Jul 17.....enlisted in 3rd Regiment Revolutionary War

--Jun 1775 Camp Ticonderoga (Essex) NY military service

28 Sep 1775 Camp Ticonderoga (Essex NY sick in camp

1790 Poughkeepsie Town, Dutchess, NY, USA census

Born 1756. Some say born in Ireland, Enlisted with Captain Lewis Dunboy's Company in Colonel James Clinton's 3rd Regiment - The Line of NY Forces during Revolutionary War.

Married by "Banns or Licence" in the Reformed Dutch Church.

Appears in 1790 census as male, over 16.

Died between 1810-1840
